channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Could legal weed make you sick? Here's how California tries to keep it safe

item.title: One family. One attack. 132 names. A Gaza investigation
item.description: More than 50,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's war with Hamas, Gaza health officials say. We reconstructed what happened in one of the dea...

item.title: Reporter's notebook: 8 theories why fentanyl deaths are plummeting
item.description: Some 30,000 fewer people are dying every year in the U.S. from fentanyl and other street drugs. This shift has stunned addiction experts, reversing de...

item.title: Dreams of a three-peat come crashing at the NCAA basketball tournament
item.description: Florida ends UConn's bid to repeat — again — in Sunday action that saw a memorable buzzer-beater. Meanwhile, South Carolina advances in the women's to...

item.title: Wife of slain Cal Fire Captain Rebecca Marodi arrested in Mexico
item.description: Yolanda Marodi is accused of stabbing her wife, Cal Fire Captain Rebecca Marodi, to death in February.

item.title: First black Republican congresswoman Mia Love dies at 49
item.description: Love made history when she was voted into the House of Representatives for Utah, but was diagnosed with brain cancer in 2022.

item.title: Who could be Canada's next PM and how will they be chosen?
item.description: The country's new Prime Minister Mark Carney has called for a national election on 28 April.

item.title: Conan O'Brien honored at Kennedy Center but Trump targeted by many comics
item.description: Conan O'Brien was honored at the Kennedy Center but many comics targeted President Trump from the stage.

item.title: South Korea court reinstates PM as acting leader
item.description: The court has dismissed Han Duck-soo's impeachment, as South Korea's political turbulence continues.

item.title: NewJeans announce hiatus after setback in court battle
item.description: The K-pop group, which now call themselves NJZ, announce a pause after debuting a new song.

item.title: DNA testing site 23andMe files for bankruptcy protection
item.description: The company said that it will now attempt to sell itself under the supervision of a court.

item.title: 3/23: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Pope Francis released from hospital after more than a month; Iconic movie props up for auction
